t: Jeremiah 12
Jeremiah’s Complaint
Righteous*pn are you, O Lord,*s when*ld I complain to you; yet*ld I would plead my case before you. Why*ln does the way of the wicked prosper? Why*ld do all who are treacherous thrive?
You*ln plant them, and they take root; they*ld grow and produce fruit; you*ln are near in their mouth and*ld far from their heart.
But*ln you, O Lord,*s know me; you*ld see me, and test my heart toward you. Pull*ln them out like sheep for the slaughter, and*ld set them apart for the day of slaughter.

How*ln long will the land mourn and*ld the grass of every field wither? For*ln the evil of those who dwell in it the*ld beasts and the birds are swept away, because*ld they said, “He will not see our latter end.”
The Lord Answers Jeremiah
“If*pn you have raced with men on foot, and they have wearied you, how*ld will you compete with horses? And*ln if in a safe land you are so trusting, what*ld will you do in the thicket of the Jordan?

For*ln even your brothers and the house of your father, even*ld they have dealt treacherously with you; they*ld are in full cry after you; do*ln not believe them, though*ld they speak friendly words to you.”
“I*pn have forsaken my house; I*ld have abandoned my heritage; I*ln have given the beloved of my soul into*ld the hands of her enemies.
My*ln heritage has become to me like*ld a lion in the forest; she*ln has lifted up her voice against me; therefore*ld I hate her.
Is*ln my heritage to me like a hyena’s lair? Are*ld the birds of prey against her all around? Go,*ln assemble all the wild beasts; bring*ld them to devour.
Many*ln shepherds have destroyed my vineyard; they*ld have trampled down my portion; they*ln have made my pleasant portion a*ld desolate wilderness.
They*ln have made it a desolation; desolate,*ld it mourns to me. The*ln whole land is made desolate, but*ld no man lays it to heart.
Upon*ln all the bare heights in the desert destroyers*ld have come, for*ln the sword of the Lord*s devours from*ld one end of the land to the other; no*ld flesh has peace.
They*ln have sown wheat and have reaped thorns; they*ld have tired themselves out but profit nothing. They*ln shall be ashamed of their harvests because*ld of the fierce anger of the Lord.”*s

Thus*p says the Lord*s concerning all my evil neighbors who touch the heritage that I have given my people Israel to inherit: “Behold, I will pluck them up from their land, and I will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.
And after I have plucked them up, I will again have compassion on them, and I will bring them again each to his heritage and each to his land.

And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, ‘As the Lord*s lives,’ even as they taught my people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of my people.
But if any nation will not listen, then I will utterly pluck it up and destroy it, declares the Lord.”*s
